174.article_body: Toyota is planning to produce an average of 8 lakh vehicles per month globally in the April-June quarter due to the global chip shortage. Earlier, Toyota had announced plans to cut output in Japan by 20% in April, 10% in May and 5% in June. The firm said its production is operating as normal, but won't help recover lost output.

175.title: Shiv Sena MP demands reducing fare of Mumbai AC local trains
175.article_body: While speaking in the Lok Sabha recently, Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale called for reducing the fare of AC local trains in Mumbai. He claimed few passengers travel by AC trains. "As a solution to this, if the Railways reduce the fares of AC locals, then the ridership will increase and there will be no loss," he said.

176.title: Prostitution racket busted in Chennai spa, two held
176.article_body: Chennai police have arrested two men on the charge of running a prostitution racket at a spa in one of the busiest areas of the city. Three women were rescued. According to the police, they received information that a few people were forcing young women, who came to the city in search of jobs, into prostitution.

177.title: Investors ₹19 lakh cr richer as Sensex adds over 5,000 points in 8 sessions
177.article_body: The Sensex added more than 5,000 points and the Nifty50 gained over 1,400 points in the last eight sessions in a row, barring the March 15 trading, making investors ₹19 lakh crore richer, Moneycontrol reported on Thursday. On Thursday itself, investors' wealth increased by ₹4 lakh crore. This comes amid positive global cues, easing commodity prices and declining volatility.

178.title: Russia frees abducted Ukraine mayor in exchange for 9 conscript soldiers
178.article_body: Russian forces freed the Mayor of Ukraine's Melitopol city in exchange for nine of their captured conscript soldiers, a spokeswoman of the head of Ukraine's President's Office said. Russian soldiers exchanged had all been born between 2002-2003, "practically children", Daria Zarivna added. Following the release, Ivan Fedorov thanked Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy for "not abandoning" him.

179.title: Priest misbehaves with girl under pretext of counselling in Kerala, held
179.article_body: Police have arrested a 34-year-old priest in Kerala for "misbehaving" with a 17-year-old girl who was taken to his residence for counselling. The next day he went to the girl's house and repeated the behaviour. The girl reportedly told her friend about incident who in turn informed the school authorities. Police said that priest will be produced before a court.

180.title: 3 morning walkers killed, 1 injured after lorry mows them down in Kerala
180.article_body: Three senior citizens, who went for a morning walk, were killed in the Alappuzha district of Kerala on Thursday after being mowed down by a speeding lorry. Another person, who was also with them, suffered critical injuries and was admitted to a nearby hospital, police said. The vehicle and its driver were later taken into custody, police added.

181.title: Shops shut in B'luru as Muslim clerics call for bandh over hijab verdict
181.article_body: A few shops were shut in some areas of Bengaluru after Muslim clerics called for a day-long bandh in Karnataka to protest against the High Court's verdict on hijab. Shop owners reportedly said they would "bear this loss of business for the sake of their rights". Karnataka HC on Tuesday upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions.

182.title: Assam Police recover weapons, warlike stores from passenger bus
182.article_body: The Assam Police on Thursday recovered weapons and warlike stores from a bag in a passenger bus in the Karbi Anglong district of the state. The police along with the troops of Assam Rifles had intercepted the bus near Bokajan. "The owner of the bag had not boarded the bus," Bokajan Sub Divisional Police Officer (SDPO) said.

183.title: Video shows cobra striking man as he performs stunt, IFS officer says 'Horrific'
183.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda shared a video of a cobra striking a Karnataka man as he performs stunt with three snakes. He can be seen pulling at their tails and moving his hands. "This is just horrific way of handling cobras...The snake considers the movements as threats and follows the movement. At times, the response can be fatal," wrote Nanda.

184.title: Meta removes more Russia posts calling kid's hospital bombing a hoax
184.article_body: Meta's Facebook has removed more official Russian posts that claimed reports of Russia bombing a children's hospital in Ukraine were fake. The misinformation reportedly circulated on Russian Embassy's Twitter, Facebook and Telegram accounts after the platforms took down several posts by the embassy in the UK.

185.title: 10 CRPF personnel died by suicide so far this year, says chief
185.article_body: CRPF DG Kuldiep Singh has said that 10 personnel have died by suicide so far in 2022. "We are taking various steps to address mental stress including organising 'Chaupal' where personnel share their problems and we try to solve them," he said. "If we are unable to solve it, then we take it to the professionals," he added.

186.title: Remove flexes from Pune Metro pillars, punish offenders: BJP leader
186.article_body: BJP leader Sandeep Khardekar has sought the removal of banners and flexes from Pune Metro pillars. "Instead of just removing these flexes and boards, Maha Metro should [also] take legal action...against the wrongdoers,” Khardekar wrote to Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and Maha Metro rail officials. The Pune Metro Rail commenced its operations on March 6.

187.title: Garbage catches huge fire in Pune, smoke seen from several kilometres
187.article_body: Garbage accumulated in a canal near Pune's Pulgate area caught a huge fire on Wednesday, resulting in dense smoke that was seen from a distance of several kilometres. No person was injured and no damage reported, an officer said. He added that it was a huge fire and it took about half an hour to bring the situation under control.

188.title: School teacher runs away with minor girl student in Odisha; arrested
188.article_body: A private school teacher from Odisha's tribal-district Sundargarh was arrested for allegedly running away with one of his minor students studying in Class 8. According to police, the teacher, who was also the girl's Math tutor, entrapped her into a relationship and eloped with her. He was caught by Kutra police team in Bihar's Siwan district after her father's complaint.

189.title: Moody's slashes India's FY22 GDP growth estimate from 9.5% to 9.1%
189.article_body: Moody's has slashed India's GDP growth estimate for FY22 from 9.5% to 9.1%. According to the rating agency, the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war is expected to cost India a high fuel and fertiliser import bill in FY22, leading to reduced government spending and a reduction in India's GDP growth. Moody's has projected India's year-end inflation at 6.6% in FY22.

190.title: Used to be rackets & strings, now this: Ukraine tennis star Alex on pic of gun, army gear
190.article_body: Ukrainian tennis star Alex Dolgopolov has shared a picture of military gear and an assault rifle on Twitter amid war with Russia. "Used to be rackets and strings, now this," he wrote with the picture. "I'm back, to help with what I can and defend our home," he wrote in another tweet.

191.title: DRDO constructs 7-storey building in record 45 days for developing fighter jets
191.article_body: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has constructed a seven-storey FCS Complex in record 45 days in Bengaluru. The building would be used as the R&D facility for the indigenous development of fifth-generation Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA). Defence Minister Rajnath Singh inaugurated the FCS Complex in Bengaluru on Thursday.

192.title: Pakistan's performance was probably best-ever in match-saving cause: Raja
192.article_body: Praising Pakistan for their performance in the second Test against Australia, which ended in a draw, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said their batting was probably the best-ever in a match-saving cause. "Babar Azam probably played the best innings of his life," he added. Babar scored 196 runs while Mohammad Rizwan remained unbeaten at 104 runs in their second innings.

193.title: Species of frog believed to be mute chirps first time in 100 years
193.article_body: Ecuadoran biologist Jorge Brito discovered a toad belonging to the Rhinella festae species chirping in the forest while trekking. The brown frog species characterised by its rough skin and prominent nose was believed to be mute ever since it was discovered 100 years ago. Brito took the toad to a laboratory and found it could sing without a vocal sack.

194.title: Bengaluru student dies by suicide after lecturer rejects his project record
194.article_body: A 20-year-old student from Bengaluru studying hotel management in Mangalore died by suicide allegedly after his lecturer rejected his project record and told him that he would not be allowed to sit for an exam. The student has been identified as B Bharath. In a police complaint, Bharath's father has accused the lecturer and college chairman for his son's death.

195.title: Doglapan chodo: Ashneer to BharatPe board on 'making crores with T20 WC passes' allegation
195.article_body: Ashneer Grover responded to the allegations of making crores of rupees by selling free passes during ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2021, by tweeting, "Board waalo yeh sab Doglapan chodo." He also shared a picture from the tournament, and wrote, "What I am actually doing is ensuring Suhail Sameer (CEO) and Sumeet Singh don't drink silly the hospitality section dry."

196.title: India has world's 3rd highest number of self-made billionaires: Hurun
196.article_body: As per the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, India ranks third in the list of self-made billionaires with 119 such individuals. These individuals have cumulative wealth of $474 billion. China has the most number of self-made billionaires at 1,050, with $3.756 trillion combined wealth, while the US stands second with 523 self-made billionaires, whose combined wealth is $3.554 trillion.

197.title: Ukraine war's impact on fossil fuel prices will boost renewables: German minister
197.article_body: German minister Patrick Graichen has said the impact of Russia-Ukraine war on fossil fuels will boost the means needed to curb climate change. "The core technologies to become independent of (Russian President Vladimir) Putin and to drive forward climate protection are the same," he said. "They are renewables, efficiency and electrification. These will get a massive boost," he added.

198.title: UP ends all COVID-19 curbs, allows weddings at 100% capacity
198.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Thursday released an order, underlining that all COVID-19 restrictions have been lifted in the state amid dipping cases. The order said weddings and other events can take place at full capacity of the venue while following coronavirus-appropriate behaviour. Water parks and swimming pools can reopen and Anganwadi centres can resume functioning, the order read.

199.title: If Putin is afraid to fight, I'll use only my left hand & I'm not left-handed: Musk
199.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk, who challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to "single combat" amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, tweeted, "If he (Putin) is afraid to fight, I will agree to use only my left hand and I am not even left-handed." Musk tweeted this after Putin's ally Ramzan Kadyrov told Musk, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's."

200.title: Noida-Greater Noida Metro services to start after 2 pm on Holi
200.article_body: The Noida-Greater Noida Metro services will be available from 2 pm on the occasion of Holi on Friday. The parking facility at Noida Sector-51 station will also be available from 2 pm. "Normally on working days, NMRC metro trains services start from 6 am," Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) Managing Director Ritu Maheshwari said.

201.title: Tennis player who defeated Federer seen carrying Kalashnikov rifle amid Russia attack
201.article_body: Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky who defeated Roger Federer in the second round at Wimbledon in 2013 has taken up arms amid Russia's attack on the country. Stakhovsky was seen patrolling the Maidan Square, armed with a Kalashnikov rifle and a pistol in his belt. "I'm not sure how I am going to react to shooting at somebody," he said.

202.title: Bhagwant Mann unfurls new anti-mafia era in Punjab: Navjot Singh Sidhu
202.article_body: A day after resigning as the Punjab Congress chief, Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday said, "Bhagwant Mann unfurls a new anti-mafia era in Punjab with a mountain of expectations." "The happiest man is the one from whom no one expects…hope he rises to the occasion, brings back Punjab on the revival path with pro-people policies…best always," Sidhu tweeted.

203.title: Mahatma Gandhi Green Triangle inaugurated in Madagascar
203.article_body: Ambassador of India to Madagascar, Abhay Kumar inaugurated a Green Triangle named after Mahatma Gandhi along with Mayor of Antananarivo Naina Andriantsitohaina to mark the Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav on Wednesday. At the ceremony, Kumar said the initiative highlights Gandhi's vision and philosophy when it comes to reducing consumerism, respecting nature and aiming for sustainable development.

204.title: B'luru Police arrests 4 for dacoity bid, seizes machetes & daggers
204.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru City Police on Thursday arrested four persons who were reported to be preparing for dacoity in the city. The crime branch has also seized long machetes and daggers from the possession of the accused persons. Police have registered a case against them at VV Puram Police Station and launched an investigation into the matter.

205.title: boAt launches its first "Made In India" smartwatch, Wave Pro 47
205.article_body: boAt has launched its first "Made in India" smartwatch, Wave Pro 47 with 1.69" HD display. The smartwatch features a square dial with 500 nits of brightness. With IP67 waterproofing and dust resistance, Wave Pro 47 has up to 7 days of battery life, multiple sports modes, real-time SpO2 monitor, live cricket scores, and customized fitness plans.

206.title: ₹59 cr allotted for Southern Railways, ₹13,200 cr for Northern Railways: DMK MP
206.article_body: DMK MP Kanimozhi has claimed that the budget allocated for Southern Railways towards new lines in 2022-23 is ₹59 crore, whereas the budget allocated for Northern Railways is ₹13,200 crore. She has asked the Union Railway Minister to look into the disparity. "Pointed out the discrimination...in the allocation of funds between South and North India," Kanimozhi tweeted.

207.title: Was kicked out of 13 films, refused to do their films now: Vidya Balan
207.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan said that she was earlier replaced in 13 films and that she now gets calls from the producers who replaced her. "In the recent times, I have received calls from them (producers who earlier replaced her in their films) but I politely refused to be part of their films," she said.

208.title: Shouted 'don't kill my people'; forgot it was acting: The Kashmir Files actor
208.article_body: The Kashmir Files actor Bhasha Sumbli, who's also a Kashmiri Pandit, revealed that it was emotionally traumatising to relive the brutal massacre in the film. She said, "Vivek sir had cast Kashmiri Pandits there. When they were being shot with bullets, I started shouting...'don't kill my people'." "I had forgotten that acting was happening...I had a panic attack," she added.

209.title: Russian forces stealing food, evicting civilians: Ukraine's Sumy Oblast Guv
209.article_body: Governor Dmytro Zhyvytsky of Ukraine's Sumy Oblast has claimed that the Russian forces are evicting the civilians from their homes and stealing food. Zhyvytsky reportedly gave details about the looting through Telegram on Wednesday. Earlier, reports of Russian troops surviving merely on onions, potatoes and pickles had surfaced after Ukrainian forces seized a battlefield kitchen.

210.title: Russian invasion of Ukraine has largely stalled on all fronts: UK
210.article_body: UK's Ministry of Defence, in the latest Defence Intelligence update on Ukraine situation, said that the Russian invasion of Ukraine has largely stalled on all fronts. "Russian forces have made minimal progress on land, sea or air in recent days and they continue to suffer heavy losses," it added. "The vast majority of Ukrainian territory...remains in Ukrainian hands," it stated.

211.title: Musk to exit Miss Universe owner Endeavor's board, firm says 'he has little time'
211.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk will resign from the board of directors of Endeavor, with effect from June 30, 2022. "We know he has a lot of demands and little time and we appreciate the support he provided us," the company said. Endeavor owns the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) and the Miss Universe pageant.

212.title: Relationship was initially consensual, says Delhi HC as it grants bail to rape accused
212.article_body: Granting bail to a rape accused, the Delhi High Court said it cannot be ignored that he "has clean past antecedents" and that the nature of the relationship between the parties "was initially consensual and went sore". According to the complaint, the accused would pressurise the woman to continue with the relationship and threaten to commit suicide and kill her.

213.title: Indian-origin Miss World runner-up Shree overcame facial burns, Instagram post goes viral
213.article_body: An Instagram post of Shree Saini, the Indian-origin Miss World 2021 runner-up, revealing she suffered burns after a car accident, has gone viral. Sharing a video, she wrote, "I was in a major roll over car accident that left my face with bleeding wounds. I no longer had my face. I couldn't even recognise myself."

214.title: iPhone-maker Foxconn to work under COVID-19 bubble in China: Report
214.article_body: Apple supplier Foxconn plans to work under COVID-19 bubble arrangement at its Shenzhen campus in China to resume production until at least Sunday, Reuters reported citing an internal document. The firm has arranged for some staff to live and work in a bubble. Foxconn's major production for iPhone reportedly occurs in Zhengzhou, while only a small part occurs in Shenzhen.

215.title: Lifetime achievement award: Hillary Clinton thanks Russia for sanctions
215.article_body: After Russia imposed sanctions on Hillary Clinton, the former US State Secretary tweeted, "I want to thank the Russian Academy for this Lifetime Achievement Award." Russia on Tuesday had unveiled sanctions against several US political figures, including Clinton and President Joe Biden, in retaliation to US sanctions on Russia over Ukraine war. Clinton and Biden are banned from entering Russia.

216.title: ED issues summons to TMC's Abhishek Banerjee, wife in coal scam case
216.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued fresh summons to Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Abhishek Banerjee and his wife for questioning in connection with the alleged coal scam in West Bengal. Abhishek and his wife have been asked to depose before the investigation officer next week, officials said. This comes after Delhi HC dismissed their plea challenging the summons issued by ED.

217.title: Sri Lanka asks citizens to limit fuel, power consumption amid inflation
217.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has asked the citizens to limit the consumption of fuel and electricity amid protests over rising inflation in the country. "By limiting the use of fuel and electricity, the citizens can extend their support to the country," Rajapaksa said. He added that the government has asked the International Monetary Fund to allow deferring loan repayments.

218.title: IPS officer's bag found to be fully filled with peas at Jaipur airport; pic goes viral
218.article_body: IPS officer Arun Bothra has shared a picture showing a bag full of peas on Twitter. "Security staff at Jaipur airport asked to open my handbag," Bothra, who is Transport Commissioner of Odisha, wrote along with the picture. The picture shared by Bothra has gone viral with over 50,000 likes.

219.title: Pune woman books cake online, loses ₹65,191 to cyber fraudster
219.article_body: A woman in Pune lost ₹65,191 to cyber fraudster after she was made to share her bank details after booking a cake online. The woman shared an OTP that she received, after which the money was debited in five transactions. Police have booked unidentified fraudster under Sections 419 and 420 of Indian Penal Code and sections of Information Technology Act.

220.title: India will face challenge in 5 of their remaining 7 WTC Tests: Saba Karim
220.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has said India are likely to face challenges in five of their remaining seven Tests in the ongoing World Test Championship cycle. "India will face challenge in the only Test that's going to be played in England and the four against Australia [at home]," he added. Apart from these, India will tour Bangladesh for two-Test series.

221.title: Sanitation workers' fatalities reduced to 24 in 2021: Centre
221.article_body: The number of fatalities due to cleaning of hazardous sewers and septic tanks has come down in the country, Union Minister Ramdas Athawale informed the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. The number of such deaths reduced to 24 in 2021 compared to 118 in 2019, he said. He further informed that a national policy for mechanised sanitation eco-system has been prepared.

222.title: 3 Panama-flagged ships hit by Russian missiles in Black Sea
222.article_body: Three Panamanian-flagged ships have been hit by Russian missiles in the Black Sea since Russia invaded Ukraine last month, Panamanian authorities said. One ship sank but others remain afloat with damages, Noriel Arauz, Panama Maritime Authority administrator, said. At least 10 other Panama-flagged ships are in the Black Sea, Arauz added, saying the Russian Navy is restricting them from leaving.

223.title: Learn from Indian curators how to prepare turners: Aaqib Javed to PCB
223.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said the PCB should learn from Indian curators how to prepare turning tracks. "I am surprised until now Pakistan has not been able to produce pure turning tracks, which will help our spinners," added Javed. The pitches for Pakistan's two Test matches played so far at home against Australia have drawn criticism.

224.title: Islamic Centre of India urges mosques to alter Friday prayer timings amid Holi
224.article_body: The Islamic Centre of India has urged mosques to change the timings for Friday prayers amid the festival of Holi. Further, with Shab-e-Barat also falling on the same day, it asked Muslims to visit mosques and graves of their loved ones after 5 pm. Notably, 22 mosques have pushed the timings of Friday prayers after 1:30 pm.

225.title: AMD Days Sale is now live on Amazon
225.article_body: AMD Days Sale on Amazon is now live with offers on thin and light, and gaming laptops powered by AMD Ryzen™ processors. Customers can avail No Cost EMI, exchange offers, and free Prime membership from a wide range of laptops from HP, Lenovo, Acer, Dell, ASUS and MSI. The sale ends on March 19.

226.title: Witnessed how keen Rishi was to complete 'Sharmaji...' after treatment: Neetu
226.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a video of actor and son Ranbir Kapoor talking about his late father Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "This movie will always be very close to my heart!!! I witnessed the excitement when he started the movie and how keen he was to complete it after the treatment," she wrote.

227.title: A very big decision in the interest of Punjabis will be announced shortly: CM Mann
227.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday tweeted, "A very big decision will be taken today in the interest of the people of Punjab." "No one in the history of Punjab would have taken such a decision till date. I'll announce shortly," he added. Mann was sworn in as the CM of the state on Wednesday.

228.title: Lead coffin, likely from 14th cnetury, found under Paris' Notre Dame
228.article_body: Archaeologists have found an ancient lead sarcophagus with well-preserved contents, probably from the 14th century, under Paris' Notre Dame cathedral. Christophe Besnier from France's National Archaeological Institute said a small camera placed inside the sarcophagus showed "cloth remains, organic matter such as hair and plant remains". A pit was also found immediately below the cathedral floor.

229.title: Let them throw me out: Teejay on not being allowed to board Dubai flight over visa issue
229.article_body: Actress Teejay Sidhu was stranded at Delhi airport after not being allowed to board Dubai flight with her three daughters over visa issue. Teejay, who missed the initial flight, claimed Emirates staff members were rude to her and also threatened to call security. She said they weren't allowing her to stay at airport premises, adding, "Let them throw me out."

230.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy personally wrote to Zuckerberg to block Facebook in Russia: Report
230.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reportedly wrote letters to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and COO Sheryl Sandberg asking them to ban Facebook and Instagram from within Russia's borders. However, Meta's President of Global Affairs Nick Clegg replied to the letters, the report said. Facebook restricted certain Russian state media outlets in Ukraine after Zelenskyy's request, it added.

231.title: Delhi Police opposes Shahrukh Pathan's bail plea in 2020 firing case
231.article_body: Delhi Police has opposed the bail plea of Shahrukh Pathan who is accused of allegedly pointing a gun at a constable during the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots and firing three-four rounds of shots. He has a family history of criminal cases, police added. "The accused has been keeping illegal arms and ammunition...has no remorse for his illegal act," police added.

232.title: Mamata Banerjee conspiring to make WB another Pakistan: BJP's Arjun Singh
232.article_body: BJP MP Arjun Singh said West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is "conspiring to make West Bengal another Pakistan". Singh stated that Banerjee is against the Bihari migrants in the state. "Mamata Banerjee has always been against Biharis. Industries in the state are being shut down so that they don't work...Bihar people have given us labour force," Singh said.

233.title: UP man puts tractor silencer on bike, writes 'Bol dena Paal Sahab aaye the' on number plate
233.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have arrested three men for riding a bike with the number plate reading 'Bol dena Paal Sahab aaye the' and have seized their bike. The arrested men were identified as Ankit Paal, Anuj Paal and Shivam. Photos showed that the bike was modified and the accused had replaced the silencer of the bike with a tractor's silencer.

234.title: Big B invited us to dinner after Satte Pe Satta got completed: Shakti
234.article_body: Actor Shakti Kapoor said he can watch Satte Pe Satta 200 times. "I watch it whenever I'm sad," he added. The actor recalled that Amitabh Bachchan invited the entire cast for dinner after the film's shoot got completed. "That evening was...fun that we started at 8:30 pm and wrapped it up by 7 am...It was an unforgettable experience," he added.

235.title: Pics show Ukraine theatre before and after Russia dropped powerful bomb
235.article_body: Ukraine's Minister of Foreign Affairs Dmytro Kuleba has posted pics showing the Mariupol theatre before and after Russia dropped a powerful bomb. "Another horrendous war crime in Mariupol...The building is now fully ruined," he wrote. Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov had said that between 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building.

236.title: Good luck finding a wife: Sunny Leone to man who got tattoo of her name
236.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone took to Instagram to share a video with a man who has a tattoo of her name on his arm. "Hope you love me forever!! Because now you have no choice. Good luck finding a wife," she captioned the video. She can be seen wearing yellow and pink saree in video and thanking man with the tattoo.

237.title: Felt horrible, angry from inside during film research: 'The Kashmir...' writer
237.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' writer Saurabh M Pandey said that he felt horrible during the research for the film. "I had to switch to other work...I had to give it some time, I used to feel why did these things happen, used to be very angry from inside...used to be upset and angry at the same time," he added.

238.title: 73,219 posts vacant in paramilitary forces: Nityanand Rai
238.article_body: As many as 73,219 posts are vacant in paramilitary forces due to retirements, resignations, deaths and cadre reviews, MoS for Home Affairs, Nityanand Rai, told the Parliament on Wednesday. "Filling up of vacancies is an ongoing continuous process which is done as per the administrative and operational requirement of the forces," Rai added.

239.title: 3 earthquakes jolt Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh in a day
239.article_body: Three earthquakes hit Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh on Wednesday, the National Center for Seismology (NCS) informed on Twitter. While two earthquakes with magnitude 5.2 and 4.3 hit Ladakh at 7:05 pm and 7:34 pm respectively, another earthquake measuring 4.2 on the Ritcher scale hit Srinagar at 9:40 pm.

240.title: Babar Azam is the best batter in the world right now: Vaughan
240.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has termed Pakistan captain Babar Azam as the best batter across formats at the moment. "Brilliant across formats," tweeted Vaughan after Babar scored 196 during the second innings in their second Test against Australia. Babar is currently top-ranked batter in ICC rankings in ODIs and T20Is and among the top 10 in Tests.

241.title: Russians shouldn't pay for their authoritarian leader: Patreon CEO
241.article_body: Patreon CEO Jack Conte in an interview said the firm continues to operate in Russia, adding he doesn't believe individual creators "should have to pay for the misdeeds of their authoritarian leader". "They may disagree with the war, and I don't want to punish them," he added. Conte also said the decision on operations was not controversial internally at Patreon.

242.title: 1.75 crore houses completed under PM Awas Yojana-Gramin: Centre
242.article_body: As many as 1.75 crore houses have been completed under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana- Gramin (PMAY-G), MoS for Rural Development Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti said. Around 2.28 crore houses were sanctioned to the beneficiaries till March 9, 2022, she added. Union Cabinet has approved the continuation of PMAY-G till March 2024 for completion of remaining houses, Jyoti stated.

243.title: Saba Khan shares mother Sharmila Tagore's pics with Pandit Jawaharal Nehru
243.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan's sister Saba Ali Khan took to Instagram to share a video of her mother Sharmila Tagore's pictures, including one with India's first Prime Minister, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru. "A star is born...a child protégé...a star. Proud of you! Wish you life's best moments, always...Keep shining," Saba captioned the post.

244.title: Never beaten Deepika in badminton despite trying for 10 years: Ranveer
244.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he has "never" beaten wife and actress Deepika Padukone in badminton, despite trying for 10 years. "Deepika kicks my butt in badminton. I am running around sweating," added Ranveer. Ranveer and Deepika were last seen together in the film '83'. While Ranveer played cricketer Kapil Dev in the film, Deepika played his wife Romi.

245.title: Want to hold on to that forever: Kim on finding happiness with Pete Davidson
245.article_body: Speaking about her relationship with Pete Davidson, Kim Kardashian said that she decided to seek her happiness and she found it. "I was like...'I'm in my 40s like f**k it...go for it. Find your happiness'," she added. Kim further said she feels "so good" after finding happiness with Pete. "I want to hold on to that forever," she added.

246.title: The tragic truth told brilliantly moves everyone: Kirron on 'The Kashmir...'
246.article_body: Talking about 'The Kashmir Files' which stars her husband-actor Anupam Kher, actor-politician Kirron Kher tweeted, "The stark and tragic truth told brilliantly moves everyone." "It is the chronicling of a humanitarian crisis that was ignored for...years," added Kirron. "[Director] Vivek Agnihotri used to hug me..., we cried. It was...one of the most difficult roles," Anupam had earlier said.

247.title: For weeks I have been heckled, threatened, questioned: Man Utd’s Rashford
247.article_body: Reacting to a video of him arguing with a fan who "abused" him after Manchester United's exit from Champions League, forward Marcus Rashford said, "For weeks I've been heckled, threatened, questioned..., my emotion got the better of me." "I [have] been heckled from the minute I stepped foot outside the ground, abuse not just aimed at my football," added Rashford.

248.title: 61,882 arrested in drug trafficking cases in 2021: Govt
248.article_body: A total of 61,882 persons were arrested by the central and state Drug Law Enforcement Agencies (DLEAs) in drug trafficking cases across the country in 2021, the government informed on Wednesday. Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said 99.36% of them were Indians, 0.64% were foreign nationals as per the provisional data of Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB).

249.title: People with new COVID variant had mild symptoms of fever, headaches, muscle dystrophy
249.article_body: Israel has said that two patients who have tested positive for a new variant of COVID-19 had mild symptoms of fever, headaches and muscle dystrophy. It however said that they did not require any special medical intervention. The variant may have originated in Israel, health ministry director-general Nachman Ash said.

250.title: Year's 1st cyclone 'Asani' likely to form over Bay of Bengal on March 21: IMD
250.article_body: This year's first cyclone, 'Asani', is likely to form over the central Bay of Bengal on March 21, said India Meteorological Department (IMD). It is unlikely to cross the Indian coast but heavy rain and strong winds are expected over Andaman and Nicobar Islands. "Our models indicate Asani may cross Bangladesh or adjoining north Myanmar coasts," said an IMD official.

251.title: China's richest billionaires gain $71 billion as stocks jump most since 2008
251.article_body: The combined net worth of China's 75 richest billionaires surged by $71 billion on Wednesday as stocks across Hong Kong and China jumped the most since the 2008 financial crisis. Tencent's Pony Ma, NetEase's William Ding and Pinduoduo's Colin Huang, added over $5 billion each to their net worths, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

252.title: Next two months are going to be special: Rahul as he joins LSG's bubble
252.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul entered the mandatory three-day quarantine ahead of the IPL season and said that the next two months are going to be very special. "The new season gives us a great opportunity as a new franchise to do something special," he added. LSG will play their first match against Gujarat Titans on March 28.

253.title: It told us where we stand: Nagaland captain as Jharkhand score 1,297 runs
253.article_body: Jharkhand qualified for the quarterfinals of the Ranji Trophy 2021-22 after taking a lead of 1,008 runs against Nagaland, having scored 1,297 runs across both innings. Nagaland captain Rongsen Jonathan said he is "happy" to concede 1,297 runs in a match, as it tells them where they stand. Jharkhand's 1,008-run lead marks the highest-ever lead in a first-class match.

254.title: Thought Lara will struggle with on-drives, he hit 3 fours in 1 over: Muralitharan
254.article_body: Muttiah Muralitharan said he tried to dismiss Brian Lara by opening the mid-on area to encourage him to play on-drives, which were difficult to play with the ball spinning during Lara's 221 in Colombo back in 2001. "[Lara] hit three fours in the mid-on region in one over," added Muralitharan. "I am...amazed by the shots [he] played," stated Muralitharan.

255.title: 1.44 lakh illegal foreigners identified, over 30,000 deported: Assam govt
255.article_body: More than 1.44 lakh illegal foreigners have been identified till January 31 on the basis of the Assam Accord, out of which 30,014 have been deported to their country of origin, said the state government on Wednesday. Minister Atul Bora added that 98.35% of fencing work along the India-Bangladesh border in the state has been completed.

256.title: 2 men on high-end racing bike snatch woman's gold chain in Pune; case filed
256.article_body: Two men, riding a high-end racing bike, allegedly snatched a gold chain from a woman riding pillion with her husband on his motorcycle in Pune. The incident reportedly happened on Tuesday night when the couple was returning home after purchasing groceries. The couple has lodged an FIR at Nigdi Police Station. Attempts are on to arrest the robbers, police said.

257.title: 5 arrested for stealing gun of Raghav Chadha's security officer in Punjab
257.article_body: The Nawanshahr police have arrested five persons accused of stealing a revolver from AAP leader Raghav Chadha's security officer during the party's victory roadshow in Amritsar. The police said that the accused were caught after they hit a car with their Scorpio while travelling from Nawanshahr to Khatkar Kalan. The police recovered the stolen revolver during checking.

258.title: Reliance's drastic action came as a surprise: Future Retail on stores' takeover
258.article_body: Future Retail (FRL) has said it's committed to taking all actions "necessary to seek value adjustments and reversal of takeover of stores" by Reliance Industries (RIL). RIL's "drastic and unilateral action" to takeover stores came as a "surprise" to FRL, it added. It also complicated the positive scenario which was building up after the CCI order in December, FRL claimed.

259.title: Delhi court grants bail to man who tried to break into NSA Doval's house
259.article_body: A Delhi court granted bail to a man who was arrested in February for trying to break into National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval's residence on Tughlaq Road. "Considering...the background of accused and the fact that accused is in custody since February 16 and no more is required for investigation, the accused/applicant is admitted to bail," the court added.

260.title: How many Kashmiri Pandits have been repatriated?: Cong's Randeep Surjewala
260.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala criticised the Centre and said, "How many Kashmiri Pandits have been repatriated?" He added, "How many Kashmiri Pandits have been given jobs?" Addressing a press event, Surjewala said that atrocities had been occurring even during the VP Singh-led government. "Only one party protested. Opposition leader Rajiv Gandhi gheraoed the Parliament," Surjewala added.

261.title: Man hits friend with stone, stabs him to death after argument in Nagpur
261.article_body: A man killed his 24-year-old friend after an argument in Nagpur's Kalmana area. Reports said that the two were consuming alcohol and that the accused slit the victim's throat following an argument, after which, the victim started running. But the accused caught him and hit him in the head with a stone. He then stabbed the victim to death.

262.title: Rizwan saved the Test for us eventually: Babar on Karachi Test
262.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has said it was Mohammad Rizwan who saved Karachi Test for them against Australia after he remained unbeaten at 104. "We took the onus and the main focus was to build partnerships right throughout the day," said Babar, who himself scored 196 runs during their chase of 506 runs. Abdullah Shafique scored 96 in the innings.

263.title: BSF seizes 2 Pakistani fishing boats in Gujarat's Bhuj
263.article_body: Two Pakistani boats were seized by the Border Security Force (BSF) at Sir Creek area in Gujarat's Bhuj on Wednesday. "Movement of two Pakistani fishing boats and four-five Pakistani fishermen was observed by...BSF. The Pakistani fishermen on observing the BSF troops coming towards them fled into the Pakistani territory...BSF...chased them and seized two...boats," BSF said in a statement.

264.title: UK warns Russia 'likely resorting to less precise weapons'
264.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry on Thursday said Russia's failure to control Ukrainian airspace means it has probably "expended far more stand-off air launched weapons than originally planned". "As a result, it is likely Russia is resorting to the use of older, less precise weapons, which are less militarily effective and more likely to result in civilian casualties," the ministry added.

265.title: Shreyas can look 25 & 42 at same time: 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' director Jayprad
265.article_body: 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' director Jayprad Desai said actor Shreyas Talpade can look 25 and 42 at same time. "We always wanted somebody who embodies the body language, the physicality of a cricketer...Shreyas is a powerhouse performer...I was glad when we got to know that he had agreed to come on board and he has delivered an exemplary performance," he added.

266.title: Mumbai lost over 2,000 hectares of urban tree cover in 5 years: Study
266.article_body: Mumbai lost about 2,028 hectares of urban tree cover in the past five years, a study by World Resources Institute (WRI) India revealed. The data published in the Mumbai Climate Action Plan (MCAP) said Central and Western Mumbai recorded the maximum decrease in tree cover. The loss contributed to emission of 19,640.9 tonnes of CO2 per year, the report added.

267.title: Grandmother asks Guj man who he's talking to on call, he hits her with ladle
267.article_body: A 21-year-old man hit his 69-year-old grandmother with a ladle after she asked who he was speaking to over the phone. The grandson, Ruchit, reportedly started abusing her. The woman, Shanta Supehia, asked him not to use foul language against her, following which, he hit her with the ladle. Shanta then started bleeding and her husband came to her rescue.

268.title: Dharmendra shares pic with son Sunny, says 'Rare chance to be with him'
268.article_body: Taking to Twitter, veteran actor Dharmendra shared a picture with his son Sunny Deol, from a vacation in the mountains. The photo showed them posing for the camera with a large, snow-capped mountain behind them. Sharing the picture, Dharmendra wrote, "Extremely happy to be with Sunny. A rare chance to [be] with each other."

269.title: Officials to evaluate pollution impact of Supertech towers demolition
269.article_body: Ahead of the Supertech twin towers demolition in Noida Sector 93A, the state pollution control board will evaluate the amount of pollution which will be caused in the process. "With regard to...pollution aspect, laws will have to be complied (with)," said UPPCB officer Praveen Kumar. The process is expected to briefly cause a spike in the quantity of dust particles.

270.title: Thane man dies by suicide with 11-yr-old daughter, blames police officer
270.article_body: A man allegedly died by suicide along with his 11-year-old daughter in Shahapur town of Thane. Victim Vikas Kedare allegedly blamed a police officer in a two-page suicide note, police said. According to police, Kedare and his mother were arrested after his wife died by suicide last year. He was released after spending four months in jail, police added.

271.title: South Korea reports record 6 lakh COVID-19 cases and record 429 deaths in 24 hours
271.article_body: South Korea reported a record 6,21,328 new daily COVID-19 cases, and a record 429 daily deaths, the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency said on Thursday, amid a wave of Omicron infections. The country reported 55% increase in daily COVID-19 cases. South Korea had reported 4,00,741 cases on Wednesday.

272.title: Hardik Pandya passes Yo-Yo test at NCA, Prithvi Shaw fails it: Reports
272.article_body: Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya passed Yo-Yo test at a camp at NCA in Bengaluru, while Delhi Capitals' Prithvi Shaw failed it, reports said. The standard score to clear the test is 16.5. As per reports, Shaw scored less than 15, while Hardik scored more than 17 in the test. Hardik also bowled regularly at the camp, reports added.

273.title: World's biggest telescope captures star with ancient galaxies in background, pic released
273.article_body: James Webb Space Telescope, the world's biggest and most powerful space telescope, completed its final round of fine phasing to correct its alignment errors. During the process, the telescope focussed on a single star, however, several ancient galaxies and stars also showed up in the background due to the telescope's sensitive optics. NASA released a picture of the star.

274.title: Delhi's air quality improves to 'moderate' category; AQI at 190
274.article_body: Delhi's air pollution level improved on Thursday morning with the Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded at 190 as per the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). According to SAFAR, the AQI improved due to an increase in the maximum temperature. Further, Gurugram and Noida recorded an AQI of 149 and 193 respectively on Thursday morning.

275.title: Indian-American contestant Shree Saini becomes 1st runner-up at Miss World 2021
275.article_body: Punjab-born Shree Saini was crowned the first runner-up at the 70th Miss World beauty pageant held in Puerto Rico. She is the first Indian-American to win Miss World America. Having completed her Bachelor's Degree in Journalism, Shree is currently working as a Business Manager at her father's company and as a Keynote Speaker.

276.title: Govt admits IIM-Rohtak Director didn't meet qualification criterion but was still appointed
276.article_body: After repeated denials, the Union Government has admitted to the court that IIM-Rohtak Director Dheeraj Sharma, whom it had appointed, did not meet the minimum educational qualification criterion. He was appointed despite securing a second division at the undergraduate level. Sharma completed his five-year term on February 9 this year and has got a second term.

277.title: Netflix tests charging a fee for sharing accounts outside households
277.article_body: Netflix is testing charging a fee to subscribers who share accounts with people outside their households. The sharing of accounts is "impacting our ability to invest in great new TV and films", Netflix said. The feature will be tested in Chile, Costa Rica and Peru, allowing users to add two people who don't live with them, for an extra charge.

278.title: Sensex jumps 1,000 points after US Fed's 1st rate hike in 3 years
278.article_body: Indian benchmark indices gained over 1.5% on Thursday, tracking gains in the global markets, following the US Federal Reserve's first rate hike in over three years. The Sensex jumped over 1,000 points to trade above 57,800, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped more than 280 points to trade at 17,250 levels. HDFC and Kotak Mahindra Bank were among top gainers.

279.title: 4 killed, over 90 injured after 7.4 magnitude earthquake hits Japan
279.article_body: At least four people have been killed and over 90 have been injured after a 7.4 magnitude earthquake struck northern Japan on Wednesday night and prompted a tsunami warning. Tens of thousands of households have been left without power after the earthquake. The quake struck the same region where a powerful earthquake triggered the Fukushima nuclear disaster 11 years ago.

280.title: Powerful bomb dropped by Russia on theatre sheltering 1,000-1,200 people in Ukraine
280.article_body: Russian forces dropped a powerful bomb on a theatre in Ukraine's Mariupol on Wednesday, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov said that between 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building. Russia's Defence Ministry said its forces had not struck the building and instead accused the Azov Battalion, a far-right Ukrainian militia, of blowing it up.

281.title: Russians, Ukrainians facing attacks in Germany, say police
281.article_body: The German police have said that they have registered at least 500 reports of politically motivated attacks against the Russian and Ukrainian communities in the country since the conflict between the two countries broke out. Some bottles were reportedly thrown at the windows of a Russian church in Berlin. In another incident, a Ukrainian refugee family's car was burned.

282.title: You won't see players playing for ₹16 cr in PSL: Aakash on Raja's remark on IPL
282.article_body: Reacting to PCB chief Ramiz Raja's remark that players will choose PSL over IPL if they go for auction, commentator Aakash Chopra said, "You won't see a player playing for ₹16 crore in the PSL...market dynamics [won't] allow that." Aakash added, "Chris Morris' one ball, when he played last time, was more expensive than the players' salary in other leagues."

283.title: Honour to watch him bat: Eng batting coach on Root's 2nd straight Test ton
283.article_body: England batting coach Marcus Trescothick has said it's an honour to see England Test captain Joe Root bat during the matches. Root slammed his second hundred in as many innings after scoring 119* off 246 on Day 1 in the ongoing second Test against West Indies. "To get a hundred last week and repeat it again, it's superb," Trescothick added.

284.title: US' Amagi, founded by 3 Indians, turns unicorn after raising $95 mn
284.article_body: US-based SaaS mediatech startup Amagi has become a unicorn after raising $95 million led by Accel. Others who participated in the funding include Norwest Venture Partners and Avataar Ventures. Founded by three Indians, Baskar Subramanian, KA Srinivasan and Srividhya Srinivasan, Amagi has raised over $245 million to date. It had raised $100 million around six months ago.

285.title: Want to live your best life? Make it happen: Godrej Park Retreat
285.article_body: Spread across 13 acres, Godrej Park Retreat offers 1, 2 and 3 BHK apartments in Sarjapur Road, Bangalore. Godrej Properties revealed that the township is situated close to the best hospitals, educational institutions, hotels, recreation centres and many large tech parks. Godrej Park Retreat has a clubhouse, 50+ amenities and 4.06 acres of greens.

286.title: Karan, Ananya & Manish attend Shweta Bachchan's b'day party, pics surface
286.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's daughter, Shweta Bachchan, celebrated her 48th birthday on Wednesday. Several Bollywood celebrities including Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan, Karan Johar, Ananya Panday, Manish Malhotra, Sidharth Malhotra and Shanaya Kapoor attended the party. As pictures surfaced online, Shweta seemingly kept white as the colour theme for her guests' outfits.

287.title: Ill-fated van was bought days ago: Mother of Indian student killed in Canada
287.article_body: Mother of 24-year-old Harpreet Singh, who was one of the five Indian students killed in a road mishap in Canada, said that the "ill-fated van had been purchased merely a few days ago". "For the last two years, he had been working as a driver on a work permit. He had been driving students from Brampton to Montreal," she added.

288.title: Only 60 aged 12-15 yrs get vaccinated in Pune as CoWIN glitch halts process
288.article_body: Only 60 children aged between 12 to 15 years could get vaccinated on first day of vaccination process for them in Pune. The Pune Municipal Corporation had set up 29 centres for vaccination of the age group. However, no registrations could be done due to glitch in the CoWin website. The website reportedly only started working post-lunch hours.

289.title: Govt to implement ₹7,500-cr scheme to tackle road mishaps: Nitin Gadkari
289.article_body: The Centre said it is planning to partner with the World Bank to implement a ₹7,500-crore scheme to reduce accident-prone areas and black spots on national and state highways, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said. India doesn't have a good record on road accident front and registers the world’s highest deaths due to it at 1.5 lakh every year, Gadkari added.

290.title: Over 2 lakh kids in 12-14 age group given COVID vaccine doses on Day 1
290.article_body: As many as 2,60,136 kids aged 12-14 were given COVID-19 vaccine doses on the first day as vaccination for 12-14 age group started on Wednesday, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. More than 2.15 crore precaution doses for identified categories of beneficiaries (HCWs, FLWs and over 60 years) for COVID-19 vaccination have been administered so far, the Ministry added.

291.title: Who voted for and who voted against Russia at ICJ over Ukraine invasion?
291.article_body: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) asked Russia to immediately halt its invasion of Ukraine in a 13-2 decision. Out of the 15 judges at the ICJ, judges from USA, Slovakia, France, Morocco, Somalia, Uganda, India, Jamaica, Lebanon, Japan, Germany, Australia and Judge ad hoc  Yves Daudet voted against Russia. Judges from Russia and China voted for Russia.

292.title: BJP MLA demands separate state of North Bengal in WB Assembly
292.article_body: BJP MLA from Darjeeling's Kurseong, Bishnu Prasad Sharma, on Wednesday demanded a separate state of North Bengal in the West Bengal Assembly. "The hills have been deprived for a very long time. Various communities...such as Gorkhas, Rajbanshis, Adivasis have been deprived," Sharma added. "We want North Bengal to be a separate state so that our problems are addressed," he stated.

293.title: Only 101 children turn up for vaccination in Chandigarh Tricity on Day 1
293.article_body: The COVID-19 vaccination drive for children aged 12-14 years which kicked off on Wednesday, opened to a poor response in Chandigarh Tricity with only 101 kids showing up to get the jab. The first dose of the Corbevax vaccine was administered to four, 37 and 60 children in Mohali, Chandigarh and Panchkula respectively on the first day.

294.title: Who is Miss World 2021 winner Karolina Bielawska?
294.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska, who has been crowned Miss World 2021, is currently studying for a Master's Degree in Management and would like to continue her studies with a PhD. She also works as a model and hopes to become a motivational speaker. "She enjoys swimming and scuba diving and playing tennis and badminton," read a post by Miss World organisation.

295.title: Deepfake video shows Zelenskyy telling Ukrainians to surrender; he calls it 'childish'
295.article_body: A video purportedly showing Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy calling on his country's forces to lay down arms is a "deepfake", Meta said, removing the video from Facebook. Zelenskyy also rebutted the video, calling it a "childish provocation". "I only advise that the troops of the Russian Federation lay down their arms and return home," he said.

296.title: Who is Dalveer Bhandari, the Indian judge who voted against Russia at ICJ?
296.article_body: Justice Dalveer Bhandari, the Indian judge who voted against Russia at the International Court of Justice, was born in Jodhpur. Bhandari practised at the Rajasthan High Court from 1968 to 1970 and then went to US on an international scholarship to pursue a Master of Laws degree. He also served as a senior judge of the Supreme Court of India.

297.title: Military operation in Ukraine developing successfully: Putin
297.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that the military operation in Ukraine was developing successfully. "The operation is developing successfully and in strict accordance with plans," he said. Asserting that Russia had no other option than to send troops, he added, "We will not allow Ukraine to serve as a springboard for aggressive actions against Russia."

298.title: I'm practising hard, not thinking too much about Team India call-up: Dhawan
298.article_body: Team India batter Shikhar Dhawan, who'll feature for PBKS in the upcoming IPL season, has said he's practising hard and not thinking too much about the Team India call-up. "If it doesn't happen then [also] I'm happy and without tension," he stated. Dhawan's appearance has been limited to ODIs since he was dropped from India's 2021 T20I World Cup squad.

299.title: Got fired for reviewing Tesla's FSD tech on YouTube: Ex-US employee
299.article_body: A former US Tesla employee John Bernal has claimed he was fired after he posted reviews on Tesla's driverless tech on his YouTube channel. He said his YouTube channel was cited as the reason for his dismissal. Bernal said Tesla also cut off his access to the FSD Beta system in the vehicle he personally owns.

300.title: Labourer kills co-worker, dumps body on river bank in Pune; arrested
300.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 36-year-old labourer for killing a co-worker and dumping his body on the banks of Mula river. "One of them had sold a phone to the other and payment was pending. A fight ensued over pending payment while they were consuming alcohol and the accused picked up a rock and smashed the other's head," police said.

301.title: India reports 2,539 new COVID-19 cases, 60 deaths; active cases at 30,799
301.article_body: India has reported 2,539 new COVID-19 cases and 60 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 60 deaths, 22 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 38 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,132, and the active cases declined to 30,799.

302.title: What was the answer that won Poland's Karolina Bielawska the Miss World 2021 crown?
302.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska was asked, "What's the most important discovery yet to be discovered?" "We all have unique experiences and all of us can learn something about ourselves...It costs us so little to enrich others' lives," she said. "If you'd like to discover something new, try to learn to be rich in more empathy, in compassion, in gratitude," Karolina added.

303.title: I wouldn't change too much, but catches could've made the difference: Cummins
303.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins has said he wouldn't change too much in terms of their tactics in the second Test against Pakistan, which ended in a draw after Pakistan managed to save three wickets. He, however, also admitted that missed catches in the second innings could've made the difference. Australia missed at least four catches in Pakistan's second innings.

304.title: Girls who questioned hijab verdict are members of terror body: BJP leader
304.article_body: BJP leader Yashpal Suvarna, who is also Vice-President of Udupi Government PU College Development Committee, on Wednesday said that the girls who questioned Karnataka High Court's verdict upholding hijab ban are "anti-national" and "members of a terrorist organisation". "The girls have proved once again that they are not students but members of a terrorist organisation," he said.

305.title: PM & govt must rise above petty politics, propaganda films: Owaisi
305.article_body: AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi said PM Narendra Modi and the Centre must rise above their "petty politics" and "propaganda films", criticising Union Minister Rajnath Singh's statement concerning the accidental missile-firing which landed in Pakistan. Citing a report claiming, India's accidental missile-firing prompted Pakistan to prepare a retaliatory strike, Owaisi said Singh's statement told nothing.

306.title: 19-yr-old girl steals ₹8 lakh from home, elopes with man in Zirakpur
306.article_body: A 19-year-old girl and her 22-year-old boyfriend were booked by police after the girl stole ₹8 lakh from her home and eloped with the man. The girl's family alleged the man instigated their daughter into stealing the money after luring her with marriage. She went missing on February 28. Her parents found she eloped with her boyfriend through her friends.

307.title: All truth-seekers should watch 'The Kashmir Files': RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
307.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that all the truth-seekers should watch the movie 'The Kashmir Files'. His remarks came after meeting the movie's director Vivek Agnihotri and actress Pallavi Joshi in New Delhi. "A brilliantly written script, a complete artistic work and a thorough research," Bhagwat said. The movie was released in theatres on March 11.

308.title: Don’t Memorise acquired by Infinity Learn
308.article_body: Infinity Learn by Sri Chaitanya announced acquisition of Don't Memorise, a multilingual YouTube content platform, founded by Ganesh Pai. Ujjwal Singh, CEO of Infinity Learn, said he welcomes 2.5 million users to its family with open arms. Ganesh calls this acquisition a golden opportunity to develop more K-10 learning solutions and scale their YouTube channel even more.

309.title: Don't want anyone to reduce my achievements: Vidya on not working with husband
309.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan, who's married to producer Siddharth Roy Kapur, said they decided not to work together after their 2013 film 'Ghanchakkar'. "I don't want anyone to reduce my achievements to saying this happened for you because of your husband," she added. "One has worked...hard to get here and...I don't want that to happen for either of us," Vidya said.

310.title: Bappi Lahiri's daughter breaks down as his grandson sings late singer's song
310.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's daughter Rema Lahiri broke down at an event when her son Swastik Bansal sang one of the late singer's songs at an event recently. In his tribute, Swastik sang 'Kabhi Alvida Naa Kehna' which was composed by Bappi Lahiri and sung by Kishore Kumar. Swastik also broke down towards the end of his performance.

311.title: Doing our best to ensure production at Shanghai plant: Tesla
311.article_body: Tesla has said it is doing its best to keep production going at its Shanghai factory amid China's COVID-19 prevention measures. This comes after a Reuters report said the firm had suspended production at the plant for two days. "We are actively cooperating with the government's requirements for nucleic acid testing and other epidemic prevention requirements," Tesla said.

312.title: Pune's double-decker flyover opened for public, to reduce traffic congestion
312.article_body: Pune's double-decker Nal Stop flyover has been opened for public use. It will help in reduction of traffic congestion on Karve Road in the city. "At Nal Stop, 35,000 to 40,000 vehicles pass every hour during peak hours, so it's important to have a flyover on this stretch," Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol had earlier said.

313.title: Liquor shops closed for 2 days in Hyd's Rachakonda ahead of Holi
313.article_body: Liquor shops will remain closed for two days from 6 pm on Thursday to 6 am on Saturday within Rachakonda Commissionerate limits ahead of Holi, police said. Wine shops, toddy shops and bars attached to restaurants, excluding those attached to star hotels and clubs, would be closed, police added. Groups moving aimlessly on their vehicles are prohibited, police stated.

314.title: 'The Kashmir Files' didn't show complete truth, only violence: C'garh CM
314.article_body: After watching 'The Kashmir Files' with several MLAs on Wednesday, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that the film did not show the complete truth and the makers only tried to highlight violence. "The film did not have any message. No attempt to offer any solution was made. I don't believe such a film has any relevance," said Baghel.

315.title: Bengaluru police arrest interstate car thief; recover SUVs worth ₹4 crore
315.article_body: Bengaluru police arrested a car thief who allegedly orchestrated at least 21 thefts in Bengaluru, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, and Telangana. Police have recovered SUVs worth ₹4 crore from the accused, who has reportedly been involved in car thefts since 2003. "Accused used hacking devices and key-making machines to unlock high-end cars," Bengaluru City DCP (North East Division) Anoop Shetty said.

316.title: Poland's Karolina Bielawska crowned Miss World 2021, India's Manasa reaches semi-final
316.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska was crowned Miss World 2021 by Jamaica's Toni-Ann Singh, in San Juan, Puerto Rico. US' Shree Saini was named first runner-up while Olivia Yace from Cote d'Ivoire was named second runner-up. Manasa Varanasi, who represented India, was among the semi-finalists. The event was earlier scheduled to take place in December 2021, but was postponed due to COVID-19.

317.title: Joe Biden calls Putin 'war criminal', Russia says it's 'unacceptable'
317.article_body: US President Joe Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "war criminal" for the first time, after Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the US Congress. He also offered $800 million worth of new weaponry to Ukraine that includes armed drones. Putin's spokesman Dmitry Peskov said the comments made by Biden were "unforgivable rhetoric" and "unacceptable", as per state-run TASS.

318.title: US woman abused online after being mistaken for Russian Foreign Minister's daughter
318.article_body: A US realtor has been abused online by people mistaking her for daughter of Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov amid the war in Ukraine. Ekaterina Lavrova said, "People wish you to burn in hell, you know, 'you should be deported,' 'let's take over her apartment and host somebody from Ukraine.'" Lavrov's daughter shares the same name as the US realtor.

319.title: Sharapova, Schumacher booked for fraud for promoting Gurugram real estate project
319.article_body: Gurugram Police have booked former Russian tennis star Maria Sharapova and former Formula 1 racer Michael Schumacher for fraud and criminal conspiracy. Delhi's Shafali Agarwal complained she booked an apartment in a project named after Sharapova and was cheated of nearly ₹80 lakh. Agarwal complained Sharapova made false promises, had dinner parties with buyers but the project never took off.

320.title: Actress Park Ha-sun contributes to emergency relief in Ukraine
320.article_body: South Korean actress Park Ha-sun contributed to an emergency relief campaign to help Ukraine, her agency reportedly said. It added that the donation will be used to "purchase food and daily necessities for Ukrainian children and residents suffering from the war". She reportedly donated 10 million won (over ₹6 lakh) to NGO 'Korea Food for the Hungry International' (KFHI).

321.title: Went through depression, he was the only one who didn't leave: Shama on James
321.article_body: Actress Shama Sikander, who recently got married to American businessman James Milliron said that he did not leave her during her phase of depression. "I would get depressed...I did not want anybody around me...I would push them to go away...everybody would leave...he was the only one who did not leave," she said. "James said 'Sorry, I can't leave'," she added.

322.title: India's judge votes against Russia over Ukraine invasion at International Court of Justice
322.article_body: India's judge at International Court of Justice, Justice Dalveer Bhandari, voted against Russia as the UN's top court asked Russia to immediately stop its invasion of Ukraine. Thirteen judges voted against Russia, while two judges voted in favour of Russia. Earlier, India had abstained from voting on the Ukraine-Russia issue at the UN Security Council and UN General Assembly.

323.title: 3,837 kids vaccinated in Delhi on Day 1 of vaccination for 12-14 yrs old
323.article_body: As many as 3,837 kids were vaccinated against COVID-19 in Delhi on Wednesday which was the first day of vaccination for those in the 12-14 age group. Northeast Delhi vaccinated the maximum number of children at 2,310, followed by North Delhi at 362. About six to seven lakh children in the 12-14 age group are eligible for vaccination in Delhi.

324.title: Philippines designer makes gowns, dresses out of recycled waste
324.article_body: A designer from Philippines has been making dresses out of waste materials like recycled newspapers, plastic wrapping and rice sacks using a foot-operated sewing machine. Seamstress Leonora Buenviaje said clothes made from such items are both economical and fashionable. Her frocks and gowns, which she weaves out of plastic, are sometimes used in beauty contests and pageants, Reuters reported.

325.title: Pune Police forms special squads to maintain vigil on Holi
325.article_body: The Pune Police has formed special squads at the police station level to maintain a vigil on anti-social elements during Holi celebrations. The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation Commissionerate has also formed around 10 such squads. Officials will patrol streets in civil clothes and police teams will be stationed in sensitive areas.

326.title: Delhi Traffic Police details measures to ensure safe Holi celebrations
326.article_body: Delhi Police Joint Commissioner (Traffic) Vivek Kishore said police personnel will be deployed on all major roads and intersections on the occasion of Holi (March 18). He also urged citizens to avoid traffic violations like drunken driving, overspeeding and triple-riding. Delhi's Food Safety Department has also directed officials to ensure adulterated food products are not sold during Holi.

327.title: Air purifiers to be installed at traffic intersections in Mumbai
327.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to install air purifiers at traffic intersections to reduce the impact of carbon emissions in the city. BMC has identified 70 traffic junctions where these purifiers will likely be installed in the days to come, senior civic officials said. One purifier has already been set up at the Mahapalika Marg near BMC headquarters.

328.title: London's V&A museum holds its first male fashion exhibition
328.article_body: London's V&A museum is holding its first exhibition dedicated to men's fashion. The 'Fashioning Masculinities: The Art of Menswear' exhibition would display menswear from centuries, including the 18th century to the present date, while shining light on designers, tailors and artists. "The approach to...show was to look at both fashion and art," senior curator of fashion Claire Wilcox said.

329.title: To oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress: Rebel leaders
329.article_body: After meeting post Congress' loss in recent Assembly polls, party's G-23 leaders said in order to oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress. The leaders demanded Congress to initiate dialogue with like-minded forces to create way for credible alternative for 2024 general elections. They added that only way forward for Congress is to adopt model of collective and inclusive leadership.

330.title: Only shows requesting position of Russian side: Ukraine on report of tentative peace plan
330.article_body: After Financial Times said Ukraine, Russia have drawn up tentative peace plan to end war, Ukraine's presidential adviser Mikhail Podolyak tweeted, "FT published a draft, which represents requesting position of...Russian side. Nothing more." "Ukrainian side has its own positions. Only thing we confirm...is ceasefire, withdrawal of Russian troops and security guarantees from...countries," he said.

331.title: Germany records 2,62,593 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
331.article_body: Germany's Robert Koch Institute (RKI) on Wednesday reported 2,62,593 new COVID-19 cases. The country's seven-day incidence rate rose to a record 1,607 infections per 1,00,000 people for the first time over the past week. The RKI also reported 269 COVID-19 related deaths, raising the total death toll in Germany since the pandemic began to 1,26,142.

332.title: Barcelona sign shirt, stadium sponsorship deal with Spotify
332.article_body: Barcelona on Tuesday said it signed a shirt and stadium sponsorship deal with audio streaming site Spotify. The brand's name will appear on the front of the men's and women's team shirts for four years from the 2022/23 campaign onwards. The club's stadium will also be renamed to Spotify Camp Nou. The deal is reportedly worth over $300 million.

333.title: Anything can happen: Red Bull’s Verstappen ahead of Bahrain Grand Prix
333.article_body: Red Bull's Formula One world champion Max Verstappen believes that "anything can happen" ahead of the Bahrain Grand Prix on March 20. "The car looks good and as a team, we are in a good place," the 24-year-old said. "I'm looking forward to seeing where we are compared to the rest of the grid come qualifying on Saturday," he added.

334.title: Coming from a broken home, music was the only avenue I had: Shruti
334.article_body: Actress and musician Shruti Haasan in an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla shared her experience with music. "Coming from a broken home, and not having a way to express myself, music was the only avenue I had," the 36-year-old said on music being everything for her. She revealed she sang English numbers at a restaurant in Mumbai when nobody knew her.

335.title: I am going to relax, watch a movie: Pooja Hegde on her Holi plans
335.article_body: In an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla recently, actress Pooja Hegde opened up about her plans for Holi and said she's "going to relax and watch a movie". While sharing her childhood memories of the festival, she added, "Now as an actor, I...don't have the liberty of playing Holi because I am always shooting something...I don't want to take the risk.

336.title: Russia accuses Bangladeshi media of 'biased' coverage on Ukraine war
336.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to Bangladesh, Alexander Mantytskiy, has written an open letter to Bangladeshi media outlets, accusing them of "biased" reportage on Ukraine invasion. Mantytskiy stated that the media outlets were following "anti-Russian propaganda", motivated by "prejudice". Reacting to it, a Bangladeshi news editor said that a foreign ambassador shouldn't tell journalists how to do their job.

337.title: Cong appoints leaders to assess situation after loss in 5 states
337.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday appointed senior leaders Jairam Ramesh, Ajay Maken, Jitendra Singh, Rajani Patil and Avinash Pandey to assess the post-poll situation and suggest organisational changes. This comes after Congress' loss in the recently held Assembly elections in five states. Sonia had on Tuesday asked the party's state unit chiefs in these states to resign.

338.title: K'taka ACB raids 18 govt officials; gold necklaces, cars recovered
338.article_body: The Karnataka Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Wednesday conducted raids against 18 officers regarding disproportionate asset cases and started searches at 75 places across the state. ACB seized three cars, eight gold necklaces from Bengaluru's Traffic Safety Department's Additional Commissioner Gnanendra Kumar. ACB seized a bungalow belonging to engineer Ashok Reddy of Krishna Bhagya Jala Nigam.

339.title: Ukraine captures hacker who was allegedly helping Russian troops
339.article_body: The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has captured a hacker that the country claims was helping the Russian troops with mobile communications in Ukraine. According to SBU, the hacker was allegedly helping to route calls from within Russia to the mobile phones of Russian troops in Ukraine. The hacker was also sending text messages to Ukrainian officers proposing they surrender.

340.title: Jharkhand break world record for taking highest-ever lead in a first-class match
340.article_body: Jharkhand have broken the world record for taking the highest-ever lead in a first-class match. Jharkhand took a total lead of 1,008 runs against Nagaland in their Ranji Trophy 2021-22 pre-quarterfinal. Jharkhand were bowled out for 880 in their first innings before dismissing Nagaland for 289. Jharkhand scored 417/6 in their second innings as the match ended in a draw.

341.title: They made me feel ugly: Vidya on producers replacing her in films
341.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan in a recent interview shared how producers replaced her in over a dozen films and behaved very badly with her. "They made me feel so ugly that for six months, I couldn't...look at myself in the mirror," she said. The 43-year-old recalled how during one such rejection she walked for hours and "cried a lot".

342.title: Record 4,00,000 new COVID-19 cases recorded in South Korea in 24 hours
342.article_body: South Korea reported a record 4,00,741 new daily COVID-19 cases, the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency said on Wednesday. According to the Associated Press, South Korea saw its deadliest day yet of the pandemic on Tuesday, with 293 deaths. South Korea is currently grappling with a record surge in coronavirus infections driven by the fast-moving omicron variant.

343.title: Pics show India's first rapid rail; can cover Delhi-Meerut distance in 55 minutes
343.article_body: The first look of India's first rapid rail, which will run on the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut corridor and cover a distance of 82 km in just 55 minutes, has been unveiled by National Capital Regional Transport Corporation. The upcoming RRTS trains will reportedly have 2×2 transverse seating, overhead luggage racks, CCTV cameras, sockets at every seat for laptop/mobile charging among other amenities.

344.title: Was asked to praise mediocre contestants: Sonu on Hindi reality shows
344.article_body: Singer Sonu Nigam has said that he has turned down several Hindi reality shows because he's tired of being asked to praise contestants even when the song isn't good. "I don't like that...I don't look forward to earning money and I don't see the necessity of being a part of a show just for the sake of it," he added.

345.title: The Kashmir Files used to divert attention from issues: Raj minister
345.article_body: Rajasthan Food and Civil Supplies Minister Pratap Khachariyawas on Wednesday said BJP is using 'The Kashmir Files' to divert people's attention from issues like inflation and unemployment. He blamed BJP for the exodus of Kashmiri pandits, saying it was their government at the Centre when it took place. "The Congress has fought against terrorism and always opposed it," he said.

346.title: ICC Prosecutor holds virtual meeting with Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
346.article_body: The International Criminal Court's (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan on Wednesday held a virtual meeting with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during his visit to Ukraine. "I was pleased to hold important exchanges with the president while in the country," Khan said. Both agreed that all efforts were necessary to "ensure international humanitarian law is respected".

347.title: If Kashmir Files can be made, Lakhimpur Files can be made too: Akhilesh
347.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said if the movie The Kashmir Files can be made on Kashmir, then Lakhimpur Files can also be made. In October 2021, a car belonging to the son of the Minister of State for Home Affairs, Ajay Mishra allegedly ran over farmers, who were protesting against farm laws in Lakhimpur Kheri.

348.title: How does 2022 Women's World Cup points table read after India's 2nd defeat?
