348.article_body: After suffering their second defeat in 2022 Women's World Cup, India are now on the third position on the points table with four points from four matches. Australia are on top of the table with four wins in four matches. Pakistan, who are yet to win a match in the tournament, are last on the table.

349.title: Unvaccinated Djokovic free to play French Open 2022 as things stand, say organisers
349.article_body: Unvaccinated players, including Novak Djokovic, will be free to play at French Open 2022 as things stand, the French Tennis Federation (FFT) said on Wednesday.  "Our goal is to have the best possible entry list," tournament director Amelie Mauresmo said. Djokovic was not allowed to play Australian Open due to his COVID-19 vaccination status.

350.title: My mother supported me despite health & financial problems: Shantanu
350.article_body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari said that his mother supported his talent of dancing despite having health and financial issues. "She did whatever she could do in Calcutta to make sure...I'm participating in all the competitions, I'm being visible in the shows where named artists are coming," he stated. Shantanu added that he started performing for money to support his family financially.

351.title: Russia suffering heavy losses in Ukraine: UK's Ministry of Defence
351.article_body: The UK's Ministry of Defence on Wednesday said Russia has suffered "heavy losses" as they continue to face "sustained" Ukrainian resistance, adding it's likely the casualty toll is making it difficult to launch offensive operations. "Continued personnel losses will also make it difficult for Russia to secure occupied territory," it said. Around 5,000 Russian troops have reportedly been killed.

352.title: Japan to revoke Russia's 'Most Favoured Nation' status amid Ukraine war
352.article_body: Japan will revoke Russia's 'Most Favoured Nation' (MFN) status amid Ukraine invasion, PM Fumio Kishida has said. Japan will impose curbs on export of luxury items to Russia and ban import of goods from there, he added. The MFN status calls for World Trade Organization member countries to treat each other equally with respect to few trade barriers, low tariffs.

353.title: Russia-Ukraine war is a massively destabilising event: Zuckerberg
353.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Tuesday said the Russia-Ukraine war is a "massively destabilising world event". "It's really tough to find the right words that really mean anything in a situation like this," he said. Meta is working to continue running its services in the region so that Ukrainians can continue using them, Zuckerberg added.

354.title: Ola Electric appoints ex-LG Chem Power CEO Prabhakar Patil to board
354.article_body: Former LG Chem Power CEO Prabhakar Patil has been appointed to the board of Ola Electric, Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said on Wednesday. "We'll set up a cutting edge cell manufacturing facility with up to 50GWh capacity...in India. Dr Prabhakar's expertise will help the company accelerate this process of bringing indigenously designed and manufactured cells to the market," Aggarwal said.

355.title: Congress' G-23 leaders meet after party's poor performance in polls
355.article_body: A group of rebel Congress leaders, also known as G-23, met at senior leader Ghulam Nabi Azad's residence, days after the party performed poorly in five Assembly elections. Those who reportedly attended the meeting were Kapil Sibal, Anand Sharma, Manish Tewari, Mani Shankar Aiyar and Shashi Tharoor. The leaders met amid calls for a change in Congress' leadership.

356.title: Ryan's so instantaneous with responses of lines, it's inspiring: Zoe
356.article_body: Actress Zoe Saldana, speaking about working with Ryan Reynolds in 'The Adam Project', has said, "He's witty, but when you get to meet him, he's so down to earth." She further revealed that Ryan writes his material and added, "He's just so instantaneous with the responses of lines and things like that. It's inspiring to witness that."

357.title: No plan to privatise Indian Railways, no ban on recruitment: Minister
357.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Wednesday said the government has no plans to privatise the Indian Railways and that there's no ban on recruitment. "The track belongs to railways, stations belong to railways, engines belong to railways, trains belong to railways, signalling systems belong to railways," he said. He further added that recruitment is going on for 1.14 lakh vacancies.

358.title: College student dies by suicide in MP; note recovered
358.article_body: A private college student allegedly died by suicide by jumping off a building in MP's Indore. The second-year BCom student, identified as Rajani Nilore, also left a handwritten suicide note. The incident is said to have taken place in the Banganga locality of the city, police said on Wednesday.

359.title: Allow Ukraine returned students to intern in govt colleges: WB CM
359.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi to provide suggestions to accommodate and allow Ukraine returned students to intern in government medical colleges. She has asked that students in "different years of studies" be accommodated "at an equivalent level in private medical colleges" and for colleges to increase the number of seats.

360.title: JDU leader's grandson shot dead in road robbery bid in Bihar
360.article_body: The grandson of a senior leader of Janata Dal United (JDU) was shot dead in Bihar's Chapra city as he resisted a robbery bid. The incident happened on Wednesday when JDU leader Baijnath Prasad Bikal's grandson Dipak Kumar was travelling on a motorbike. Many villagers assembled at the scene and blocked the road for three hours following the incident.

361.title: 15 people missing after landslide buries at least 60 homes in Peru
361.article_body: Eight people have been rescued and at least 15 are missing after a major landslide in Peru's La Libertad region, the government said on Wednesday. The landslide, which occurred on Tuesday, has left around 60 to 80 homes buried underground, according to local authorities. Meanwhile, the National Civil Defense Institute said the landslide was the result of heavy rains.

362.title: MP clinic's doctor accused of chopping off employee's private part
362.article_body: A doctor at a dental clinic in MP's Sidhi district has been accused of chopping off an employee's private part. A case was, however, registered against the employee after the doctor and clinic-owner, who was also found injured, lodged a complaint about the employee first. Police said further action would be taken after results of the employee's medical report.

363.title: Gandhi family Cong's best leadership option during crisis: Khurshid
363.article_body: Amid growing dissent within the Congress, party leader Salman Khurshid said that the Gandhi family is the party's best possible leadership option in this "moment of crisis". Khurshid further said that the party leaders want Rahul Gandhi to take over as full-time Congress president. "I hope he does so after internal polls," he said.

364.title: Navi Mumbai police sub-inspector held for accepting ₹10,000 bribe
364.article_body: A police sub-inspector in Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra, has been arrested for allegedly accepting ₹10,000 as bribe. The policeman, identified as 29-year-old Sagar Pawar, had reportedly demanded ₹20,000 initially to help the complainant, who had a case of molestation registered against him. Pawar allegedly threatened to make his case strong if he didn't give him the bribe.

365.title: Mumbai's ANC seizes 32 kg marijuana worth ₹8 lakhs; 2 arrested
365.article_body: The Anti-Narcotic Cell of the Mumbai crime branch has arrested two people and seized 32 kilograms of marijuana worth ₹8 lakhs from them. Police found them walking suspiciously and intervened to find 17 kg of marijuana worth ₹4.25 lakhs with one person and 15 kilograms of marijuana worth ₹3.75 lakhs with the other, said DCP (ANC) Datta Nalawade.

366.title: 3 dead, 3 critically ill after consuming spurious alcohol in Bengal
366.article_body: At least three people have died after consuming spurious alcohol in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district, police said on Wednesday. Three others, who were reported to be critically ill, were admitted to a hospital in Baruipur for treatment, Baruipur SP said. The accused had mistaken formalin pesticide for water and mixed it with alcohol, reports stated.

367.title: Russia ordered to immediately stop Ukraine invasion by International Court of Justice
367.article_body: The UN's highest court, the International Court of Justice (ICJ), on Wednesday ordered Russia to immediately stop invasion of Ukraine. "The order is binding under international law. Russia must comply immediately. Ignoring the order will isolate Russia even further," tweeted Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "Ukraine gained a complete victory in its case against Russia at the ICJ," he wrote.

368.title: Jamia Millia Islamia professor arrested for accepting ₹1 lakh bribe
368.article_body: The CBI has arrested a professor of Jamia Millia Islamia's civil engineering department for accepting a bribe of ₹1 lakh from a Delhi-based architecture firm, officials said on Wednesday. His two more associates were also arrested. The professor had allegedly given the structural safety certificate to Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso apartment, a part of which collapsed recently and two women died.

369.title: Will use salary for orphan girls' weddings & poor kids: U'khand MLA Umesh
369.article_body: Umesh Kumar, the newly-elected MLA from Khanpur in Uttarakhand, said on Tuesday that he will use his salary for the weddings of orphan girls and to help poor children. "Not a single rupee will be spent on personal expenses," he tweeted. Kumar, whose sting operation in 2016 against former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat gained attention, fought as an independent candidate.

370.title: Russian tech entrepreneurs to launch 'Rossgram' app after Instagram banned
370.article_body: Russian technology entrepreneurs are set to launch a photo-sharing app named 'Rossgram' in the domestic market after Russia banned Instagram. The app will launch on March 28 and have additional functions such as crowdfunding and paid access for some content. According to a photo shared by the entrepreneurs, Rossgram's colour scheme and layout will bear a strong resemblance to Instagram.

371.title: Brothers aged 8 & 6 found a month after getting lost in Amazon forest
371.article_body: Two brothers aged eight and six have been found alive almost a month after they got lost in Amazon rainforest in the Brazilian state of Amazonas. Pictures of the boys after their rescue showed them malnourished and extremely thin. They were spotted by a man cutting wood in the forest on Tuesday after police called off search for the children.

372.title: 2 million households lose power as 7.3 magnitude earthquake hits Japan
372.article_body: At least two million households were left without power, including 7,00,000 in Tokyo, electricity provider TEPCO said, after a 7.3 magnitude earthquake hit Japan. In the northeastern region, 1,56,000 households had no power, regional energy company Tohoku Electric Power said. Authorities have warned residents in Fukushima, Miyagi and Yamagata prefectures to expect aftershocks.

373.title: I’m focused on being the healthiest I can be: Hamilton on new F1 season
373.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton said he is focusing on being the healthiest he can be ahead of the new F1 season. "So, I think today, I feel the healthiest, the fittest I've ever been," he said. The new F1 season begins in Bahrain on March 20. Hamilton will feature for Mercedes alongside new teammate George Russell.

374.title: McLaren’s Ricciardo set to feature in Bahrain after -ve COVID-19 test
374.article_body: McLaren on Wednesday said driver Daniel Ricciardo has tested negative for COVID-19 and will return on Thursday ahead of the Formula One 2022 season opener in Bahrain on March 20. "Daniel has been feeling better each day as he continued to recover while in isolation following local regulations in Bahrain," McLaren said. Ricciardo tested positive for COVID-19 on March 11.

375.title: It's another tough moment for us: De Gea on Man Utd's CL exit
375.article_body: Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea said the club's exit from Champions League after losing 1-2 on aggregate to Atletico Madrid was "another tough moment for us". United will end a fifth consecutive campaign without a trophy since winning the Europa League in 2017. "There are too many years without any trophies, even without fighting for trophies," he said.

376.title: Need to change the way women are portrayed in TV shows: Archana
376.article_body: Actress Archana Puran Singh said that there's a need for a big change in the content and the way women are portrayed on television. Recalling her 1980s show 'Mr Ya Mrs', she said, "Women were shown to step out, work and earn for the family." "Currently, TV shows portray how the woman is always crying...always sacrificing her needs," Archana added.

377.title: Women tie up rape accused to tree, lynch him in Tripura's Dhalai
377.article_body: A 46-year-old rape accused was tied to a tree and lynched by a group of women in Tripura's Dhalai district on Wednesday, police said. The man had allegedly raped a five-year-old girl in a jungle on Tuesday night, who was later rescued by locals. The accused, who was beaten up the next day, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital.

378.title: Tip of the iceberg: WHO as number of COVID-19 cases rises again in countries
378.article_body: Amid global rise in COVID-19 cases, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said, "These increases are occurring despite reductions in testing in some countries, which means the cases we're seeing are just the tip of the iceberg." He added there are "unacceptably high levels of mortality" in many countries as new infections jumped by 8% last week, compared to previous week.

379.title: Who are India's 10 richest people and what are their net worths as per Hurun?
379.article_body: Mukesh Ambani is India's richest person and 9th-richest worldwide with $103 billion wealth, as per 2022 Hurun Global Rich List. Adani & family are 2nd-richest in India, followed by HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar & family, Serum Institute's Cyrus Poonawalla and ArcelorMittal's Lakshmi Mittal. DMart's Radhakishan Damani & family are 6th richest in India and SP Hinduja & family 7th richest.

380.title: Akhilesh shares clip of convoy running into bull, says, 'Journey in UP difficult'
380.article_body: Former UP CM and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav shared a clip on Wednesday that showed his convoy running into a bull on the road. "You will meet bulls on your travels, keep going if you can. The journey is very difficult in UP, keep going if you can," Yadav wrote. His car slowed down to give way to the animal.

381.title: Tsunami warning issued after massive earthquake of 7.3 magnitude hits Japan
381.article_body: A 7.3 magnitude earthquake hit the coast of Fukushima in northern Japan on Wednesday evening, triggering a tsunami advisory. The Japan Meteorological Agency said it struck 60 kilometres below the sea. The region is part of northern Japan that was devastated by a deadly 9.0 quake and tsunami in 2011. There are no immediate reports of casualties or damage.

382.title: People wouldn't know truth if not for 'The Kashmir Files': Giriraj Singh
382.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh lauded movie 'The Kashmir Files', stating that people wouldn't come to know the truth if this film wasn’t made. Singh added that the film, which has been made tax-free in eight states, should be shown across all villages in India. Directed by Vivek Agnihotri, 'The Kashmir Files' depicts exodus of Kashmiri Pandit community from Kashmir valley.

383.title: Saudi crown prince meets UK PM Johnson in Riyadh, signs MoU
383.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman met United Kingdom PM Boris Johnson in Riyadh on Wednesday, Saudi press agency SPA reported. During the meeting, Saudi Arabia and the UK signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to establish a strategic partnership council, it reported. The leaders of the two nations also discussed bilateral cooperation and means to strengthen it.

384.title: Adani added ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021: Hurun
384.article_body: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani, who ranks 12th on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, added an average of ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021, Hurun said. With a net addition of $49 billion, Adani added the most amount of wealth among the world's billionaires. Adani & his family's total wealth is estimated at $81 billion.

385.title: Russia has turned Ukrainian sky into a source of death: Ukraine Prez
385.article_body: Addressing the US Congress on Wednesday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Russia has turned...Ukrainian sky into a source of death for thousands of people." He said, "Russia has attacked not just us...it went on...brutal offensive against our values [and] against our right to live freely in our...country." He further urged the US Congress to do more to help the country.

386.title: Bhansali had called me for 'Saawariya' but I was in rehab: Prateik
386.article_body: Prateik Babbar revealed that filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali had called his house to cast him in 'Saawariya' when he was 18 years old. "I was too young...was in rehab so it couldn't have worked out," he added. Prateik stated his grandparents told him about it a few years later. 'Saawariya' marked the Bollywood debut of Ranbir Kapoor and Sonam Kapoor.

387.title: Shafali can provide India something exceptional vs Australia: Hussain
387.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain said India Women will need something "exceptional" to beat Australia in their upcoming 2022 Women's World Cup match, adding that opener Shafali Verma can make the difference. "You can't just prod along. You are going to need something above par. Shafali can provide that," stated Hussain. India Women will take on Australia on March 19.

388.title: Govt restores 5-yr e-tourist visas to156 nations after 2 yrs: Reports
388.article_body: Two years after suspending them over the COVID-19 outbreak, the government has restored valid five years e-tourist visas given to citizens of 156 countries, reports said on Wednesday. It restored regular paper visas given to nationals of all countries with immediate effect. Further, all currently valid 10 years regular tourist visas, given to US and Japan's citizens, have been restored.

389.title: Most men weren't willing to do a film where 60% was me: Kriti Sanon
389.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has said that she's been in situations where most of the male actors weren't willing to be a part of the film where 60% was her role. "These things need to change a little," Kriti added. Talking about Akshay Kumar's small role in 'Atrangi Re', Kriti said, "Akshay is...not insecure of anyone, and plays his part honestly."

390.title: My family was shocked: Raashii Khanna on her performance in 'Rudra...'
390.article_body: Sharing her family's reaction to her performance in 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness', actress Raashii Khanna said, "My family and friends were shocked...They...never thought I could pull a character like this off." "I never thought I could pull it off," added Raashii. "I had always been looking for something that threw me out of my comfort zone," stated Raashii.

391.title: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy orders daily minute of silence for war victims
391.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has ordered a daily minute of silence for the victims of the Russian invasion. He said, "Every morning at 9 am we'll remember...Ukrainians who gave their lives." Zelenskyy said the initiative mourns both Ukrainian soldiers and civilians killed in the war, adding, "All of them who could still be alive if Russia hadn't started this war."

392.title: Every other team may make a big deal of Chahar's absence but not CSK: Vettori
392.article_body: Talking about Deepak Chahar, who may miss a few CSK matches in IPL 2022 due to a hamstring injury, Daniel Vettori said, "Every other team might make a big deal out of it but [not] CSK." "I think they are one of the few teams that can survive spending ₹14 crore on a player and just moving on," added Vettori.

393.title: Muslim cleric calls for K'taka bandh tomorrow against HC's hijab order
393.article_body: The Ameer-E-Shariat Karnataka, Maulana Sagir Ahmad Khan Rashadi, has asked the Muslim community to implement a day-long bandh on Thursday in Karnataka to protest against HC's order of upholding the ban on wearing hijab in educational institutions. Saying that the protest will be peaceful, he added, "You shouldn't impose bandh by forcibly closing shops." He described the order as 'sad'.

394.title: New variant of COVID-19 detected in Israel
394.article_body: Israel's Ministry of Health has said that two cases of a new COVID-19 strain have been detected in the country. "Two cases of verified strains of a combined variety of varieties BA1 (Omicron) and BA2 were discovered in the State of Israel. This strain is not yet known in the world," it stated. It added that patients showed mild symptoms.

395.title: Pregnant Malaysian woman gifts husband ₹3cr Lamborghini over sleepless nights ahead
395.article_body: An expecting mother in Malaysia has bought her husband a Lamborghini Huracan Evo worth RM 2 million (over ₹3 crore) as a reward for the long, sleepless nights that await him once she gives birth. Anes Ayuni Osman, 19, is an entrepreneur who married in February 2021. She said she's scheduled to deliver her firstborn at the end of March.

396.title: Mukesh Ambani only Indian to enter the top 10 in Hurun Global Rich List 2022
396.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani is the only Indian to feature among the top 10 people on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. With a 24% y-o-y increase in wealth, Ambani was ranked 9th among the world's billionaires, with his wealth estimated at $103 billion. Gautam Adani & family ranked 12th globally, with their wealth estimated at $81 billion.

397.title: I'll do the film only if I'm not paid: Salman Khan reportedly told 'Godfather' makers
397.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was offered "a handsome amount" by the makers of Chiranjeevi-starrer upcoming film 'Godfather', but he didn't charge a single penny for his appearance, Pinkvilla reported. "Salman had put forth a clear condition – 'I will do the film, only if you don't pay me'," the report added. Salman loves and respects Chiranjeevi, the report said.

398.title: Chahal takes over RR's Twitter account, says 'Where are you my love Ashwin'
398.article_body: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal took over Rajasthan Royals' Twitter account and jokingly tweeted, "Where are you my love @ashwinravi99. No calls, no texts...Is there anyone else in your life?" Chahal also shared a picture of himself and wrote, "Meet RR new captain." Further, sharing another picture, he joked, "10,000 retweets and he will open with Jos Buttler uncle."

399.title: It's a better time to be female actor than male actor: Vidya Balan
399.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan, in an interview, said it's a better time to be a female actor than being a male actor. "Variety in the way...roles are written is far more exciting than what's happening in the male actor's space," Vidya said. Adding to it, Shefali Shah stated that OTT platforms have given actresses a chance to explore, express, and experiment.

400.title: Starbucks CEO to step down, Founder Howard Schultz to return as interim CEO
400.article_body: Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson will step down from his role on April 4 and Founder Howard Schultz will take over as interim CEO, the company announced on Wednesday. "I feel this is a natural bookend to my 13 years with the company," Johnson said. He will continue in an advisory role to the company and its board through September.
